elements:
Tanares Spells
Druid, Ranger
When you cast this spell, you can make 1 to 20 arrows magically enchanted for the duration, making a special magical bond with each of them. You make any ranged attack using these arrows with advantage, as well as ignoring half cover and ¾ cover that protects the target of this attack. Also, for the duration of the spell, you always know where your enchanted arrows are, as well as you can use your action to magically see through one of those arrows of your choice, and continue to do so until you use your action to return to your normal senses. As long as you are seeing through the arrow, you are blind to your own senses. You will not be able to see through one of its arrows if it is more than 1 mile away from you. If one of these arrows breaks, the enchantment no longer affects it.
3 Transmutation 1 action Self Concentration up to 1 hour true false true up to 20 arrows true false
Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Spell Saving Throw
You concentrate and gaze upon a creature within range, causing all of the pain it receives to be amplified for the duration of the spell. Whenever the target takes damage, it must make a Constitution saving throw or take an additional 1d8 necrotic damage. If this additional damage reduces the target’s hit points to 10 or fewer, it must make a Strength saving throw or drop anything it is holding on a failed save.
necrotic 3 Necromancy 1 bonus action 60 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true false component true false
Cleric
When you cast this spell, you instill in you and your allies the spirit of the arena. You and every willing ally within 20 feet of you has advantage on Strength ability checks, Strength saving throws and all saving throws against effects that cause the frightened condition. While a creature has this effect active, it deals +2 on all damage rolls it makes, including attacks and spells. The bonus is applied to each damage caused individually before any other modifier.
1 Enchantment 1 action 20 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true false component true false
Cleric, Druid, Paladin
When you cast this spell, .you create a 20-foot radius aura around you. Allied creatures that start their turns within the area regain hit points equal to 1d6 + your proficiency bonus. Also, it supresses all magical effects that are causing a condition affecting allied creatures within the area. Lasting effects or conditions do not cease to affect the creature, but are only suspended for the duration of the spell.
4 Evocation 1 bonus action Self(20-foot radius) Concentration up to 1 minute true true false component true false
Wizard, Spell Saving Throw
You conjure five small energy spheres in range, each about 2 feet in diameter, spinning at high speed and affecting a spherical area with a diameter of 10 feet. Any creature that starts its turn or enters the area takes 3d6 force damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw. As a bonus action, you can move each sphere up to 20 feet in any direction within the spell’s rang
force 3 Evocation 1 action 120 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true false component true false
Bard
You create a fixed, 10 feet high, spiritual banner in a place within range, with a symbol you are currently defendeing. Allies within a 60-foot radius area around the banner and who can see it are inspired, and for the next 10 minutes, can add 1d6 to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw. Each ally can only use this extra die once, ending this effect for them after it is used. For all purposes, this die counts as a Bardic Inspiration die. This spell can only be cast once every 8 hours.
1 Enchantment 1 action 60 feet 10 minutes true true false component false false
Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
You become a catalyst of envy, pulling the luck of an enemy towards you. When an enemy you can see makes a roll, such as an attack or a saving throw, the target must succeed on a Charisma check. If it fails, you steal that result and store it. If you do so, the target must reroll the dice that was stolen.
While maintaining concentration, you can spend the stolen value as one of your own rolls, thus ending the effect of the spell.
3 Abjuration 1 reaction 60 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true false component true false
Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Melee, Spell Attack, Spell Saving Throw
You transform one of your arms into a serpent for a moment, allowing you to make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 10d8 poison damage and becomes poisoned. On a success, the creature takes half of the poison damage and is not poisoned.
Alternatively, the serpent arm can spit the poison in a 10-foot cone, starting up to 10 feet from you, and all creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 6d8 poison damage and become poisoned, taking 1d6 poison damage at the start of their turns. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the condition on a success. Creatures poisoned by this spell cannot become poisoned by it again until they finish a long rest.
poisons 5 Transmutation 1 action Self(10 feet) Instantaneous true true false component false false
Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
You infuse the body of a willing creature you touch with black flames that cover its entire body. The target becomes resistant to fire and necrotic damage. Any other creature that touches the target takes 1d6 fire damage + 1d6 necrotic damage. If the target takes damage from melee attacks, fthe attacking creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw for each attack or take damage as if it had touched the target. In addition, the same damage is caused to a creature if the target hits it with melee attacks or manage to touch it in any other way.
fire, necrotic 6 Transmutation 1 action Self Concentration up to 1 hour true true true small portion of any dragon's material true false
Paladin, Spell Saving Throw
Your armor emits a strong pulse of intense light capable of blinding opponents. Any hostile creature within 15 feet of you that can see you must make a Constitution saving throw and becomes blinded for 1 minute on a failure. Blinded creatures can roll a saving throw at the end of each of their turns to regain their sight.
2 Evocation 1 action Self 1 minute true true true medium armor or higher false false
Bard, Cleric
Choose a spell you are able to cast that is of 4th level or lower. For the duration, you grant a creature within range the ability to cast that spell one time. The target creature uses its Wisdom as its spellcasting ability for that spell and must expend the actions and components as described for the spell.
5 Enchantment 1 action 30 feet 8 hours true true true sacred symbol the other person could carry false false
Cleric, Sorcerer, Spell Saving Throw
A blade of radiant light, falls from the sky in an area of 5 feets radius, dealing all creatures within that area 10d6 radiant damage, the creatures have disadvantage on any ability check they make until the end of their next turn, that blade ignores resistances and immunities. Creatures in the area can make a Dexterity saving throw, to take half damage and not suffer the effect.
radiant 6 Evocation 1 action 60 feet Instantaneous true true true holy symbol false false
Warlock, Wizard
An energy armor forms around the caster changing their AC calculation to 12 + Dexterity modifier + Intelligence modifier. Your AC cannot be increased or reduced in any other way while this spell is active, whether by you, allies, enemies, or even items.
If a creature within 60 feet deals damage to you, you can use your reaction to shatter the armor into several shards that turn into 4 darts and launch towards the creature that damaged you. Each of the darts dealing 1d4+1 force damage to it. Doing so ends the spell.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot above 2nd when you use the reaction.
force 2 Abjuration 1 action Self 1 minute true true false component false false
Ranger
You imbue magic into a ranged weapon that uses ammo, and when used by you, it fires magical ammo created on each attack, each ammo dealing in addition to its normal damage an extra 2d12 damage and all damage dealt is a force damage.
force 5 Transmutation 1 bonus action Self Concentration up to 1 minute true false false component true false
Bard, Cleric, Paladin
You encourage and give hope to all friendly creatures 40ft of this spell’s range, all gain 2d8 temporary hit points and a +2 bonus to their AC, attack rolls, ability checks, and saves. The effects last for the duration.
4 Evocation 1 action 120 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true false component true false
Bard, Cleric
You hold a diamond and make a circular motion with your arm, saying the name of your God, creating a light on up to three willing creatures that you can see within range. Each creature heals for 5d8 and no longer suffers the effects of the conditions afflicting it.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell in higher spell slots, you affect one more creature per spell slot used above 7th.
7 Evocation 1 action 60 feet Instantaneous true true true a diamond worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes false false
Wizard
You create eight cube-shaped platforms whose edge is 10 feet. You can position them as you wish, but at least one of them must be within 90 feet of you and they must all be connected to each other, with at least one of their sides necessarily touching the other of the cubes in order to connect them all. Each platform can hold up to 1000 pounds of load and the creatures can choose to walk or walk through them. With a bonus action on your turn, you can move all of them up to 15ft, rearranging them as you wish, while respecting the prerequisites mentioned above. Moving them this way causes creatures on top of it or in the middle of it to magically move this way. At any time, as a bonus action, you can end this spell, and all creatures over the platforms will fall normally.
At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or greater, you can create 2 more platforms for each slot level above 3rd.
3 Evocation 1 action 90 feet Concentration up to 1 hour true true true jewel worth 20gp true false
Druid, Cleric
You create a light and gentle breeze that rushes through the area relieving pain, effects and healing your allies. Creatures of your choice within a 60-foot cone recover 4d6 hit points and, if any, recover from 1 level of exhaustion.
3 Evocation 1 action 90 feet Instantaneous true true true a mint leaf or similar herb false false
Druid, Spell Saving Throw
When you cast this spell, a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square you can see within range. The first time a creature enters the area on a turn, or if it ends its turn there, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be frozen for the duration. A frozen creature takes 10d6 cold damage at the start of each of its turns and is petrified. The cold damage ignores resistance. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a successful saving throw, it is no longer frozen. If a frozen creature starts its turn outside the area, this saving throw is made with advantage. If a frozen creature suffers the cold damage from this spell on 5 consecutive turns, it remains petrified after the spell ends.
cold 6 Conjuration 1 action 60 feet 1 minute (concentration) true true true a small stone rune true false
Druid
When you cast this spell, a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square you can see within range. If a dead creature is in the space when the spell is cast, and it is willing, the creature is restored to life with 1 hit point, provided that it has been dead no longer than 24 hours. This spell can’t return a creature to life that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.
Each time the restored creature ends its turn in contact with the rune, it regains 10 hit points while the spell lasts.
8 Conjuration 1 action 60 feet 10 minutes (concentration) true true true a small rune carved from a gemstone worth at least 500 gp, which is consumed when the spell is cast true false
Druid, Spell Saving Throw
When you cast this spell, a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square you can see within range. The first time a creature enters the area on a turn, or if it ends its turn there, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a successful saving throw, it is no longer paralyzed. If the creature ends its turn no longer in the area, the saving throw is made with advantage.
5 Conjuration 1 action 60 feet 1 minute (concentration) true true true a small stone rune true false
Druid, Spell Saving Throw
When you cast this spell, a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square you can see within range. The first time a creature enters the area on a turn, or if it ends its turn there, a bolt of lightning strikes the creature and it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 5d6 lightning damage and is unable to take reactions until the start of its next turn.
3 Conjuration 1 action 60 feet 1 minute (concentration) true true true a small stone rune true false
Druid
When you cast this spell, a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square you can see within range. The first time a creature touches the rune after the spell is cast, the rune disappears and a willing creature is transformed for the duration. An unwilling creature may make a Wisdom saving throw; on a successful saving throw the spell ends and the creature is not transformed. You choose which transformation occurs when the rune is touched: Reptile, Avian or Plant.
Reptile. The target is covered in scales, grows a long tail, and its mouth becomes crocodilian.
The creature’s maw becomes fanged and is a natural weapon which they can attack with using your spell attack modifier. Bite attacks deal piercing damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier on a hit.
Their scaly hide provides improved protection. While they aren’t wearing armor, their AC is 13 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
The creature grows a scaly tail. The tail has a reach of 10 feet and if a creature enters its reach, the target of this spell can use their reaction to attempt to trip the creature. The creature makes a Strength saving throw against your spell DC or falls prone.
Avian. The target is covered in feathers, grows wings, gains bird-like reflexes and hawk-like eyes.
The creature gains a fly speed equal to their walking speed.
They gain advantage on any perception checks based on sight.
When they are hit with an attack, they may use their reaction to move up to their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Plant. The target is covered in bark, grows leaves and roots
The creature’s movement speed becomes 0.
The target gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning damage.
The target gains vulnerability to fire damage.
4 Conjuration 1 action 60 feet 1 minute (concentration) true true true a small stone rune true false
Bard, Warlock, Wizard, Spell Saving Throw
You create a small illusory energy globe that transforms into the object or person most coveted by the chosen target. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by the object of their desire. While charmed by this spell, the creature is incapacitated and, on its turn, will move towards the illusion, regardless of any obstacles in its path.
As a bonus action, you can move the globe up to 30ft within range of the spell. The spell ends if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.
3 Illusion 1 action 120 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true false component true false
Ranger, Warlock, Wizard
When casting this spell, you can feel the connections between this world and the Penumbral Plane, indicating where a nearby portal or rift to the Penumbral Plane may be located. You constantly sense the direction of the portal while you are within the range of the spell.
If you are playing outside of Tanares, you can find passages to the Shadowfell instead.
2 Divination 1 action Half mile Concentration up to 30 minutes true true false component true false
Bard, Wizard
You target a small non-magical campfire in range and magically transform it to be especially warm and inviting. Any creature that completes a short rest within 30 feet of the fire while this spell is in effect may roll 2 dice for each Hit Die spent to recover hit points.
1 Transmutation 1 action 30 feet 1 hour true true true some whipped sugar and gelatin false false
Bard, Wizard
When you cast this spell, a small cottage occupying a 20 foot square, with a height of 10 feet, appears in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. A small fire burns in the fireplace in the cottage, keeping the temperature at a comfortable level regardless of the weather outside. The cottage is made of wood, with a single door facing the caster. One 5-foot square window adorns each side wall of the cottage. Within, 4 sets of bunk beds each include comfortable bedding, and a padded chair faces the fireplace. A pantry in the cottage and a barrel of ale in the corner contain enough ale and provisions to sustain 8 people for one day. At the end of the duration, the cottage and any remaining contents created by the spell vanish.
For the duration, any creature that completes a long rest within the cottage may remove an extra level of exhaustion or any other single condition afflicting it.
4 Conjuration 10 minutes 30 feet 24 hour true true true a piece of bear skin false false
Bard, Wizard
You target a fireplace within range and a warm and comforting fire erupts, which lasts for 8 hours. Any creature that completes a long rest in the same room of the fireplace while this spell is in effect regains all expended hit dice.
2 Transmutation 1 action 30 feet 8 hour true true true a wood chip false false
Bard, Spell Saving Throw
You play a deadly tune. Any creature other than you within a 60-foot area that can hear your tune must make a Constitution save, if they fail, they lose half their hit points, rounded down.
8 Evocation 1 action 60 feet Instantaneous true false false component false false
Bard, Ranger, Wizard
By touching an object, the caster gets visions from it to discover precious information. There are two possible ways to use this spell;
In the first, when touching the spell, the caster can see through the object, everything that happened from the moment the object stopped in that place. For 1 hour, he can see and hear everything that happened until the object stays where he is, regardless of the amount of time the object has been standing there. Subtle movements the object may have had over time do not alter the spell’s effect.
In a second way, the caster can stipulate a specific time within 1 year and after that, he gets the vision of the object, similar to the above way.
4 Divination 1 hour Touch 1 hour true true true an object false false
Druid
You cause a magical shock and transmute manufactured objects and metal equipment, in a 20 cubic feet area, into wood. Creatures within the area must make a Charisma save. If they fail, all equipped and carried equipment made of metal is turned to wood. Objects and equipment that are not being equipped or carried are automatically turned to wood. Transformation into non-magical objects and equipment is permanent, while magical objects and equipment are transformed for 24 hours. Weapons transformed into wood are considered improvised weapons and have a -2 penalty to their roll and damage and transformed armors have a -3 penalty to their AC.
7 Transmutation 1 action 60 feet Instantaneous true true false component false false
Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
In an elaborate ritual, you wipe clean the psyche of a humanoid creature and imprint a new directive, effectively making it almost irreversible. The targeted creature is required to be seated on an obsidian structure atop a marble circle, both inscribed with arcane symbols. The creature must also be adorned with a tameranium bracelet on its right wrist and a bauronite bracelet on its left wrist.
The spell carries significant side effects; however, these are mitigated by increasing amounts of tameranium and bauronite used. With a minimum of 50 gp worth of each material, you gain 2 levels of exhaustion and are unable to cast this spell for 48 hours. Utilizing at least 500 gp of each reduces the exhaustion to one level, but the spell remains unusable for 24 hours. If you use at least 1000 gp of each, you suffer no exhaustion but are unable to recast the spell for 12 hours. The spell fails if casted before the time above pass.
The subject of the spell must remain seated for the entire casting duration. Upon completion, you may choose to implement one of the following directives (Mindless, Berserker, Focused, or Return) on the target. Subsequent castings of this spell can only reverse its effects if they focus on returning the target to their original state, or if a wish spell is used.
Mindless Soldier. The creature becomes proficient at executing orders and will only comply with commands given by individuals bound to it during the casting. You can designate any number of entities that are part of the same organization known to the creature before the ritual.
Berserker Beast. The target operates on pure instinct and obeys only the caster’s basic commands. The creature loses speech capability and becomes exceptionally hostile. The target gains advantage on Strength-based checks and saves, and its attacks dealing Strength-based damage gain a +2 bonus, while suffering disadvantage on Intelligence checks and saves.
Focused Servant. The target concentrates all its proficiency on one particular field of knowledge. Choose one skill or artisan tool. The creature gains proficiency in it, doubles its proficiency bonus for checks related to it, and gains advantage on these checks. However, it cannot apply its proficiency bonus to any other skill checks that aren’t directly related to the chosen skill or tool.
Mind Return. Consuming an object that once belonged to the target is necessary for this effect. If done, you revert the target to its state before the spell was cast on it.
5 Enchantment 2 hours (ritual) 10 feet permanent true true true An obsidian seat worth at least 1000 gp, a marble circle valued at a minimum of 1000 gp, and between 100 and 1000 gp of tameranium and bauronite equally divided, all of which are consumed in the ritual false true
Druid, Ranger, Sorcerer
You cast natural energy at a willing creature within range, which gains the following benefits for the spell’s duration:
The creature gains a +2 bonus to its AC and any saves;
The creature’s speeds increase by 5 feet;
The creature has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks, which relate to smell and hearing;
The creature’s unarmed strikes now deal 1d6 + Strength or Dexterity modifier (its choice). The damage type will be the same as the creature normally deals with its unarmed strikes.
2 Enchantment 1 action 30 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true false component true false
Druid, Warlock, Wizard
You summon a shadowy shape behind the target creature that embraces you. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw, if it fails, it suffers 1d4 levels of exhaustion and its respective effects for the duration of the spell. If the creature reaches the sixth level of exhaustion, it does not die but is unconscious for 24 hours, only suffering from 5 levels of exhaustion that remain even after the spell’s duration. An affected creature that hasn’t suffered all 6 levels of exhaustion can make a new save at the end of its turns, getting rid of this spell’s effects on a success.
5 Necromancy 1 action 60 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true true a black pearl worth 100 gp true false
Bard
You conjure powerful notes that echo in a 60-foot-radius circular area from a point within the spell’s range. Hostile creatures that enter or start their turn in the area take 6d8 thunder damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. If they pass, they suffer half damage; if they fail, they must roll 1d8 to define which note ran through their body and which condition affected them according to the table below.
The condition lasts for 1 minute, and the affected creature can redo the save at the end of its turns, ending the condition on a success. If a creature receives more than one condition from this spell, it makes a single save at the end of its turns, ending all conditions that have affected it as a result of it.
d8NoteEffect
1DoThe creature is Paralyzed
2ReThe creature is Charmed
3MiThe creature is Stunned
4FaThe creature is Restrained
5SolThe creature is Silenced
6LaThe creature is Blinded
7SiThe creature is Frightened
8Chord+4d8 thunder damage and roll again on the table
thunder 9 Enchantment 1 action 120 feet Concentration up to 1 hour true true true a musical instrument true false
Cleric
You make an offering to your god, asking him for guidance on the day ahead. For the next 24 hours, anytime you roll a d20 to determine the outcome of any one action, you can choose to roll an additional d20 and choose which of the two results to use. You can declare you are using the extra d20 either before or after you make the first roll, but always before the GM declares the outcome. Once you use the roll the spell ends and can’t be used again before the next dawn.
1 Evocation 1 minute (ritual) 30 feet 24 hours true true true 8 sp in incenses, which the spell consumes false true
Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
As an action, the caster opens a 60-square-foot fissure that connects the material plane and the penumbral plane to the fissure, allowing creatures to cross from one plane to the other, right where they are. Alternatively, as an action, the caster can close a fissure between the material plane and the penumbral plane, as long as it does not exceed 60 square feet. A fissure created by this spell automatically closes if a penumbral creature comes within 5 feet of it, but reopens when there are no penumbral creatures within that range.
6 Conjuration 1 action 30 feet Instantaneous true true false component false false
Bard, Ranger, Wizard
You touch your eyes and they become yellow, allowing you to see creatures through solid objects, such as walls. For the duration, you can see creatures, not objects, through any obstacle up to 2ft thick, up to 20ft beyond the obstacle, regardless of the lack of light in the area. In this condition, the image of the creature is not sharp and its colors become only shades of red.
2 Divination 1 action Touch Concentration up to 10 minutes true true false component true false
Bard, Cleric
You make a prayer asking your god to protect the desperate and heal the wounded.
Choose up to three creatures in range, each of them heal 1d6. In addition, if the creature had 0 hit points, it receives +2 to its AC until the start of its turn, and can immediately choose to use a reaction to stand up from prone.
2 Evocation 1 action 30 feet Instantaneous true true false component false false
Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Spell Attack, Spell Saving Throw
Upon casting this spell, you launch a piece of ammunition in a grand arc towards a target, exerting immense pressure as it descends. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 force damage and is rendered prone. On a miss, the creature takes half the damage and must make a saving throw, choosing between Strength or Dexterity, to avoid falling prone.
All other creatures within a 20-feet radius of the target must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw. Failure results in the creature taking 8d6 force damage and being knocked prone, while success leads to half damage and maintaining their stance. Creatures of large size or larger have advantage on saves.
force 4 Transmutation 1 action 180 feet Instantaneous true false true munition false false
Cleric, Paladin, Spell Saving Throw
You conjure an immense blade of pure luminescence overhead, which descends and morphs into one of the forms you select:
A sweeping slash spanning a 25-foot line, inflicting 3d4 radiant damage on all creatures within its trajectory.
A powerful thrust directly in front of you, causing 3d4 radiant damage within a 15-foot cone.
Fragmenting into several shards of brilliant light, dealing 3d4 radiant damage to all creatures adjacent to you.
All creatures within the area must perform a Dexterity saving throw; on a success, they take half of the damage.
At Higher Levels. Casting this spell using a 2nd level or higher spell slot amplifies the damage by an additional 1d4 for each slot level beyond the 1st.
radiant 1 Evocation 1 action Self Instantaneous true true false component false false
Cleric, Spell Saving Throw
You call down a beam of holy light to smite an enemy. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, taking 10d8 radiant damage plus 10d8 fire damage, is permanently blinded and becomes afflicted with the effects of the Slow spell for a minute on a failure. On a successful, take half the damage, is blinded for 1 minute and is not slowed. If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you’re on, he has disadvantage in the saving throw. A permanently blind creature can only remove the condition by the spells greater restoration, regeneration, wish, or similar abilities.
radiant, fire 9 Abjuration 1 action 30 feet Instantaneous true true true (a diamond worth at least 2000 gp that has been blessed by a ceremony spell, which is consumed false false
Warlock, Wizard, Spell Attack, Spell Saving Throw
You shoot a powerful beam of dark purple energy from your open hands at a creature within range. You make a ranged spell attack against the target, and if it hits, it takes 7d6 Psychic damage and becomes frightened for 1d4 rounds. If you are in dim light or darkness, increase the damage by 3d6 and the target remains frightened for 2d4 rounds. The target takes half damage and is not frightened on a successful Dexterity saving throw.
psychic 3 Evocation 1 action 60 feet Instantaneous true true false component false false
Ranger
As an action, you exhale a luminous magical breath that reveals the tracks of passing creatures within 30 feet. For the duration of the spell, you gain a +10 bonus on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track creatures.
2 Divination 1 action Self (30-foot radius) Concentration up to 1 hour true true false component true false
Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Spell Saving Throw
You create a large shield of energy embellished with dwarven runes, which revolves around you and provides three-quarters of cover. Any creature that makes a melee attack against you takes 5d6 force damage. As a bonus action, you can transform the barrier made by the shield into a handaxe of arcane energy, which forms in your hand. You can make a ranged magic attack with the axe as an action against a creature within 6 feet of you. If successful, the attack deals 5d6 force damage, and if the creature hit by the axe is larger than you, you can attempt to trip it, allowing it to make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid. For the duration, as another bonus action, you can revert the handaxe to a shield of energy. If you take any damage, the spell ends.
force 4 Evocation 1 bonus action Self Concentration up to 1 minute true true false component true false
Druid, Ranger, Warlock, Spell Saving Throw
Upon casting this spell, beams of necrotic energy burst from the shadow of a target creature within range, seeking to ensnare it. The target creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, shadowy tendrils form around the creature for the duration of the spell, halving its speed and inflicting necrotic damage equal to 1d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
The ensnared creature may attempt a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns to free itself. Until it succeeds, it suffers necrotic damage equal to 1d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier at the beginning of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends
necrotic 1 Necromancy 1 action 40 feet Concentration, up to 1 minute true true false true false
Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Spell Attack, Spell Saving Throw
You choose a target that you can see within the spell’s range and create a sword of negative energy, which emerges from the target’s shadow and attacks it. You must make a magic attack roll for the sword to stab the creature, on a success the attack deals 4d10 necrotic damage, half of that damage is deducted from the target’s maximum hit points. On subsequent turns, you can use your action to deal an additional 4d10 necrotic damage to the creature. The sword dissipates if you use your action to take any other action.
A creature that takes damage from the sword cannot have its hit points restored by any means until the sword is removed or dispelled. A creature can remove the sword using its action and make a Charisma saving throw by taking 4d10 necrotic damage and removing the sword or taking 2d10 and keeping the sword on failure.
negrotic 7 Necromancy 1 action 60 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true true a 25 gp onyx gem, which the spell consumes true false
Paladin
You manifest a radiant energy barrier. For all purposes, it functions as a shield throughout the spell’s duration, yet allows for the execution of somatic components while casting additional spells.
At Higher Levels. This spell improves with the caster’s level, providing a +1 shield at the 5th level, a +2 shield at the 10th level, and a +3 shield at the 15th level.
1 Evocation 1 bonus action Self 8 hours true true false component false false
Cleric, Paladin
A crown of gleaming silver energy appears above the target creature’s head. The target has +1 bonus to its AC and all rolls that it adds its proficiency bonus while the spell lasts, as DC of its spells and skill checks.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above the 1st.

Bard
You intone a beautiful chant. Up to five creatures of your choice that can hear within 20 feet of you regain 6d8 hit points and have advantage on the next Constitution saving throw they make. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Bard, Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Spell Saving Throw
You create a small spark of radiant light that surrounds a 20-foot-radius area. As long as the spell lasts, hostile creatures in the area have a -1 penalty to attack rolls, AC, and ability checks. At any time, the caster can use a bonus action to end this effect by bursting the sparks and dealing 1d4 damage to all hostile creatures in the area. They can make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid this damage.
radiant 1 Evocation 1 action 60 feet 1 minute true true false component false false
Cleric, Wizard
You cast this spell at a location to summon the spirit of a creature that has been there before, allowing it to provide you with information about the events that occurred there. The spirit remains for 1 minute. When invoking the spirit, roll 1d10 to determine the amount of information it has, as shown in the table below:
d10Effect
1-2The spirit is hostile, refusing to answer your questions or even providing false information.
3-4The spirit has vague information and is not very familiar with the place, but does not act in a harmful manner.
5-8The spirit acts in a friendly manner. It knows the place, but only has rumors and incomplete information about what happened there
9-10The spirit acts in a friendly manner and has detailed knowledge of the location. It can provide accurate information about events that took place.
3 Necromancy 1 action 20 feet 1 minute true true false component false false
Cleric, Paladin
You conjure a floating spectral spirit within range that lasts for the spell’s duration or until you cast it again. When you first cast this spell, you can use it to perform a healing touch on yourself or one of your allies, restoring their hit points by 1d8 + your proficiency bonus. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the spectral spirit up to 30 feet and repeat the healing effect on a different creature.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above.
3 Evocation 1 action 30 feet Concentration up to 1 minute true true true holy symbol true false
Druid, Ranger, Spell Saving Throw
You use natural energy to release dozens of magical spores that affect a 20-foot radius sphere within range. Any creature other than you that enters or starts its turn in the affected area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, 2d4 spores stick to the creature, or half as much on a success. The attached spores explode if the creature takes any damage. The creature then takes 1d4 poison damage for each exploded spore and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw to not become poisoned for 1 minute. As long as the spores have not exploded, a creature can, as an action, make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check against your spell save DC to remove 1 of the spores attached to itself or another creature, but on failure, all spores explode.
poison 2 Evocation 1 action 60 feet Concentration, up to 1 minute true true true a dandelion flower true false
Sorcerer, Wizard, Spell Attack
You shoot a bolt of static energy against a creature within the spell’s range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target, on a hit it takes 1d8 lightning damage plus 1d8 lightning for each 5 feet it moves willingly or not, until the end of its next turn. This effect can cause no more than 5d8 damage, and ends when such amount is reached.
At Higher Levels. The initial damage is increased by 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st.
lightning 1 Evocation 1 action 40 feet Instantaneous true true false component false false
Ranger, Spell Saving Throw
When you cast this spell, you become a conduit for magical earth energy that makes projectiles you launch charged with energy. For the duration, or when the concentration ends, your ranged attacks made with a weapon deal an extra 1d6 damage, of the same type as the weapon or ammo. Also, whenever a creature is hit by one of these attacks, it must make a Strength saving throw. On failure, it will be pushed 10 feet straight away from you. Large or larger creatures have advantage on this saving throw.
1 Transmutation 1 bonus action Self Concentration up to 1 minute true false false component true false
Bard, Cleric, Paladin
When you cast this spell, you create a mystical bond between yourself and up to two creatures within range. Each targeted creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they become linked to you for the duration of the spell.
When you take damage and a bonded creature is within 120 feet, the damage is divided between you and the creature. You take half the damage (rounded down), and the bonded creature absorbs the remainder, inflicted as psychic damage. If both bonded creatures are within range, both take half of the damage. For example, if you would take 10 damage, you take only 5 and both creatures take 5 each.
At Higher Levels. For each spell slot above 4th that you use to cast this spell, you can bond with one additional creature.
4 Abjuration 1 action 60 feet 1 hour true true false component false false
Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Spell Saving Throw
You choose a creature and cause its shadow to detach and become a separate creature with the same statistics and equipment as the original. The target creature must make a Charisma saving throw or its shadow comes to life. If the shadow came to life, the shadow acts on the same initiative turn as the original creature but takes its turn immediately after. The shadow will attack the original creature with all its might and will continue to do so until it is defeated or the spell ends. The copy lasts until the spell’s duration ends or until the copy or its original drops to 0 hit points.
9 Conjuration 1 action 30 feet 1 minute true true false component false false
Druid, Sorcerer, Wizard
This spell causes up to 5 willing creatures in a 30-foot-radius area to gain 5 feet speed and can take the Dash action as a bonus action.
2 Transmutation 1 bonus action 100 feet Instantaneous true true false component false false
Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Spell Attack
You open 3 portals through the Penumbral Plane in 3 locations of your choice within range of the spell. As a bonus action, you can enter one of them and exit through any of the other two of your choice during the duration of the spell. Alternatively, if you are adjacent to one of them, you can channel energy from the portal to shoot an enemy up to 60 feet away, making a magical ranged attack and dealing 4d6 necrotic damage upon hitting. Other creatures cannot pass through the portal but can block the exit. If you pass through the portal and decide to exit through a blocked portal, both you and the creature blocking the exit take 4d6 force damage.

Bard, Melee, Spell Attack
You conjure a resonating, spectral lute within your grasp. This lute can be used to make melee spell attacks, dealing 1d10 plus your spellcasting ability modifier as thunder damage. Additionally, upon casting this spell, you can instantly execute an attack action with it.

Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Warlock, Spell Saving Throw
You call forth a spear of solid lightning to skewer an enemy. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be marked as the target of three spears that rain down from a cloud created 20 feet above the creature’s head. Whenever that creature is hit by an attack for the first time on a turn, one of the spears strikes down, dealing 4d4 piercing damage and 4d4 lightning damage. The spell ends when all three spears are used.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell creates two additional spears for each slot level above 4th.

Wizard
You create a restful environment in a 20-foot radius around you, making it an ideal place for a long rest. A long rest taken in this area only requires half the usual time, and the creature resting recovers from the effects of one additional level of exhaustion. A creature can only benefit from this spell once per long rest, and must take at least one long rest outside of this area before it can benefit from the spell again

Paladin, Melee, Spell Attack
You channel the purest light through your hand to punish or save your targets. If you use it against a hostile creature, make a melee spell attack against the target creature. On a hit, the creature takes 7d6 radiant damage, the flames spread and consume the creature’s essence imposing disadvantage on all its saves made in the next minute. If you cast it on an allied creature, it heals 7d6 hit points, the flames ignite its essence and it has advantage on all saves it makes for the next minute.

Wizard, Spell Saving Throw
You concentrate to channel the necrotic energy from the bones and piles of bodies, creating a green cloud in the sky. On your next turn, you spend your action to cause the cloud to transform into a sphere of bone necrotic energy and fall in a 30-foot-radius area within range. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 12d6 necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success. Additionally, if this damage reduces a creature to 20 or less hit points, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or die, becoming a zombie as per the Animate the Dead spell. If the creature drops to 10 or fewer hit points, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage. If the creature dies from the spell’s damage, it automatically becomes undead.
necrotic 8 Necromancy 2 action 400 feet 2 rounds true true true dozens of bones or a pile of bodies false false
Bard, Cleric
You can turn your allies’ courage into a powerful protective energy. Choose up to 3 willing creatures within range. While under this spell, you and those creatures get +1 on all saving throws, plus the following effect:
When a creature affected with the veil of bravery takes damage, it can take a reaction to reduce the damage by 1d6 for each creature within 20 feet of it that is also affected by this spell. Each creature can use this spell’s effect only once; then the spell ends for it.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage reduction die increases by one step for every two slot levels above 2nd, reducing 1d8 for a 4th level, 1d10 for a 6th level, and 1d12 for an 8th level.
2 Abjuration 1 action 20 feet 1 minute true true false false false
Ranger, Spell Saving Throw
You create an opaque wall of magic bushes on a solid surface within range. You can make a wall up to 30-foot long, 5-foot high and 5-foot thick or a ring wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 5 feet high and 5 feet thick. Each creature within the area when the wall appears, and, subsequently, any creatures that pass through the spaces it occupies, must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature must roll 1d6 to determine which effect on the table happens to it
RESULTEFFECT
1-2The twigs and vines ensnare the creature, which becomes restrained for the duration. The creature can use an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer restrained.
3-4The branches and vines begin to whip the creature, dealing 2d6 slashing damage per turn as long as it remains in the area.
5-6ranches, roots, and leaves sway around the creature, blocking its movement and vision. Terrain occupied by the wall of bushes is considered difficult terrain. While within the area, the creature has disadvantage on attacks and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight
2 Conjuration 1 action 60 feet 8 hours true true false false false
